feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for New Zealand issued by MetService
feed.rights: Copyright Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited, 2025. Licensed under Creative Commons BY 4.0.

entry.title: Road Snowfall Warning
entry.summary: Snow is forecast to affect the road during Tuesday. 8 to 15 cm may accumulate on the road around the eastern portal, with lesser amounts down to 800 metres.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Expect 90 to 120 mm of rain in addition to what has already fallen. Peak rates of 15 to 25 mm/h expected this afternoon. Note, another period of heavy rain is possible on Thursday, and another Warning or Watch may be issued closer to the time. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Minimal.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Expect 40 to 60 mm of rain in addition to what has already fallen, especially about the ranges. Peak rates of 15 to 25 mm/h. Thunderstorms possible. Note, another period of heavy rain is likely on Thursday, and another Warning or Watch may be issued closer to the time. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Minimal.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Heavy rain that fell yesterday and this morning has eased, but another period of heavy rain is forecast on Thursday. Expect 200 to 250 mm of rain. Peak rates of 30 to 40 mm/h. Thunderstorms possible. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Low.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Expect 150 to 200 mm of rain, with the largest amounts likely in the north. Peak rates of 20 to 30 mm/h. Thunderstorms possible. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Minimal.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Strong Wind Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Severe gale northwesterlies gusting 120 km/h in exposed places, especially about Central Hawke's Bay. Note, another period of severe northwest gales is possible on Thursday, and a Warning or Watch will likely be issued closer to the time. Impact: Damage to trees, powerlines, and unsecured structures possible. Driving may be difficult, especially for high-sided vehicles and motorcycles. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Minimal.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Strong Wind Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Severe gale northwesterlies gusting 130 km/h in exposed places. Note, another period of severe northwest gales is forecast on Thursday, and a Warning will likely be issued closer to the time. Impact: Damage to trees, powerlines, and unsecured structures possible. Driving may be difficult, especially for high-sided vehicles and motorcycles. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Minimal.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Strong Wind Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Severe gale northwesterlies gusting 120 km/h in exposed places. Note, another period of severe northwest gales is forecast on Thursday, and a Warning will likely be issued closer to the time. Impact: Damage to trees, powerlines, and unsecured structures possible. Driving may be difficult, especially for high-sided vehicles and motorcycles. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Minimal.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Watch
entry.summary: Heavy rain that fell yesterday and this morning has eased, but another period of heavy rain is forecast on Thursday. Rainfall amounts may reach warning criteria within 40 km east of the main divide, with thunderstorms possible. Snow level above 2500 metres. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Warning: High. Changes: Warning lifted but new Watch issued for heavy rain expected on Thursday.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Watch
entry.summary: Periods of heavy rain, with thunderstorms possible. Rainfall amounts may approach warning criteria. Chance of upgrading to a Warning: Moderate.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Warning: High. Changes: Warning lifted but new Watch issued for heavy rain expected on Thursday.

entry.title: Strong Wind Watch
entry.summary: Northwest winds may approach severe gale in exposed places. Note, another period of severe northwest gales is possible on Thursday, and a Warning or Watch may be issued closer to the time. Chance of upgrading to a Warning: Moderate.

entry.summary: West to northwest winds may approach severe gale in exposed places. Note, another period of severe northwest gales is possible on Thursday, and a Warning or Watch will likely be issued closer to the time. Chance of upgrading to a Warning: Moderate.

entry.title: Strong Wind Watch
entry.summary: West to northwest winds may approach severe gale in exposed places. Note, another period of severe west to northwest gales is possible on Thursday, and a Warning or Watch will likely be issued closer to the time. Chance of upgrading to a Warning: Moderate.
